definition: A package manager for the web, it "installs the right versions of the packages you need and their dependencies."
Hypertext Markup Language, a standardized system for tagging text files to achieve font, color, graphic, and hyperlink effects on World Wide Web pages.
Cascading Style Sheets, used to add styling to HTML pages
Version control system, widely used for software development and other version control tasks.
A central location in which data is stored and managed.

A programming language that alongside HTML and CSS, is one of the three core technologies of World Wide Web content production. The majority of websites employ Javascript and it is supported by all modern Web browsers without plug-ins.
